body: Joel, What you are asking for is very easy to do thanks to the beautiful simplicity of Grasshopper and Mostapha's brilliance in applying it.  All that you have to do if you want to assign a separate VAV system to each zone is graft the input into the Honeybee_OpenStudio Systems component like so: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IReZCGmClNQrSfErr3mzH4PIwKUNhvtgW-4Ve2cvq6lE0HzQenWFvkDDCy8*MsBNTkYHk3nTXSQTf1jbfdHviDlpl80ZVITy/GraftedVAV.JPG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IReZCGmClNRgn30MgKQiDfuzVBGUZRJENjWdOhWVbknTPKxxZPoOOkxrK0tBYXSobUyCIBEO1lssOH66rzFXp*OVRv69Pkfh/VAV_SingleZone.JPG) By default, the input into the Honeybee_OpenStudio Systems component is flattened so that you get one centralized system like this: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IReZCGmClNS5kzao1Q1swNMz6unYBsTEW7ijTcwHMJL-Y20OOZSpNv*scJP*Pxc5oQtJq7gINrQyjbSSldqoaimkOaGQg8rO/FlattenedVAV.JPG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IReZCGmClNS04K5lTBdm4K73Zfqji1pWSPYZWWdiqEuECm3Gh*DUwYh9gO-ULrClgseBQhqEYkM2Bd*LJ1oLE4WLsyzeb-3Y/VAV_TwoZone.JPG) As long as your zones are organized in a data tree / grafted list, you can assign separate systems to different groups of zones. Let me know if this is clear.  I remember it took me a good year of working with Grasshopper before I understood data trees and grafting.  It's a super-useful feature once you get the hang of it. -Chris
